reviews.title: One of the BEST concert halls in the world.
text: Koerner Hall is seriously one of the BEST concert hall venues I have been to. It is an architectural masterpiece that catches the eye immediately.  The acoustics are some of the best I have ever experienced.  I was here for a Royal Conservatory Orchestra concert and I was wowed by the sheer talent the student orchestra produces.  There is no bad seat in the house, even if you are seated high up.

Koerner Hall is part of The Royal Conservatory of Music.  The building itself is absolutely beautiful and should be checked out while here for a concert.  It's amazing how well they blend old and new at this property.
How do some people not know about this venue?  Word should be spreading like wildfire about how amazing this place is.  The concerts here are great and rival a Carnegie Hall series.
Looking forward to being back here in the future!

reviews.title: Good to be back
text: For the first time in almost two years we were able to enter Koerner Hall for a concert. It was great to be back and enjoy its excellent acoustics as well as the artists. Unfortunately the Dover Quartet was prevented from playing because of a Covid issue, but the New Orford Quartet was able to step in at short notice and played a Mendelssohn Quartet. The young US baritone Davone Tines made an excellent impression during the second half of the concert, though his program had to be changed at short notice. This is the first live music we've heard since the Pacfic Baroque Festival in Victoria more than 18 months ago. A happy new beginning!

reviews.title: Best acoustic!
text: We have been to countless concert here and have mostly been very happy. Only been disappointed when additional speakers were added. No matter the music style the acoustic is outstanding.  Seating is confortabile.

reviews.title: Perfect acoustic
text: No matter your favorite music style, this is the perfect venue to listen and enjoy! The only time we were not completely pleased,  was when mikes and speakers were added. There really is no need for them.
Seating is comfortable and the view is great from all seats.

reviews.title: Nost beautiful concert venue in downtown Toronto
text: The location is excellent, the acustics perfect, the programming varied and always of high quality and the prices are reasonable  and almost always last minute special discount tickets are available for first quality concerts if you happen to be in the neighborhood and decide to attend a concert at the very last minute.

reviews.title: Two great musical events
text: On Friday we were in Koerner Hall for the concert marking the 150th anniversary of the birth of Father Komitas, almost certainly the best-loved Armenian composer ever. On Saturday we were here again for a piano recital, Sir Andras Schiff performing works by Beethoven and Schumann. Once again we were impressed by the splendid acoustics of the place, as well as the excellent sight lines, particularly from the parterre seats. What a wonderful addition to the Toronto musical scene Koerner Hall has proved to be! Visitors to Toronto, as well as Torontonians themselves, absolutely must attend a performance there.

reviews.title: Annual visit ....invent a reason
text: Folks of all the great halls for music in the GTA this hall ranks right up there in the top three if not the top. Optimal size, comfortable seats, perfect sightlines, a unique energy.... oh and a great location with restaurants/hotels and other things to do before and after.

reviews.title: Beautiful Modern Stage
text: First time attending this venue (Anoushka Shankar), sound is very good and the space very warm, comfortable, and not a bad seat anywhere.

reviews.title: A Can't Miss Spot in Toronto
text: Oh what a joy to be in that hall. The acoustics are phenomenal. The look of the place is splendid. The timbered ceiling is stunning.
The concert we saw was fabulous but it was a toss up whether to watch what was on stage or look at the theatre.

The hall seems built into the centre of the Conservatory of Music and getting to the Hall is a long walk. Someone escorted us and I wondered where he was taking us. We went passed a long line of new, practice rooms on both sides of a hall and finally arrived at Koerner Hall.
A trip to Toronto should definitely include a concert at Koerner Hall.
Such a choice of types of music held there. This concert was for two baritones, the next will be for a jazz artist..

reviews.title: Beautiful venue
text: I love Koerner Hall.  It is a relatively small venue and it is beautiful.  Acoustics are unparalleled.  Koerner Hall sits within the Royal Academy of Music and the modern architecture is married to a older stone building in a very pleasing way. It is an intimate setting to hear some of the world’s greatest musicians.

reviews.title: Mischa Maisky Concert
text: Most beautiful concert ever. Thanks for bringing in a musician of such talent! We travelled from New Brunswick to see him and what a masterful performance. Merci beaucoup! Quelle belle musique!

reviews.title: This stunning hall should not be missed
text: We attended a recent Tafelmusik concert at Koerner Hall.  The acoustics even near the back are excellent.  The architecture integrates the old and the new seamlessly and with more than a touch of elegance, and the grounds and the location beside the Royal Conservatory of Music give added weight to the overall experience.

reviews.title: Mischa Maisky playing Bach
text: The Koerner Hall is modern venue for music on Bloor St. in Toronto.
The acoustics are truly excellent.
Mischa Maisky performed Bach Cello Suites brilliantly today and the immediacy if the experience is astonishing when you sit in the first 10 rows.
Very highly recommend this venue for any musical experience.

reviews.title: Fabulous venue!
text: Saw Los Lobos on April 23, 2016.  Excellent sound, comfortable seats, good sight lines.  Would most definitely return for another show here.   Worth the trip.   A beautiful venue!

reviews.title: One of the finest concert halls in the world!
text: We are so fortunate to live in Toronto and have a subscription to concerts in this magnificent hall! We have toured the world and have been so many concert venues - this is one of the very best. Seats are comfortable and it the experience is good from any location in the hall. The programming here is top notch and the ticket prices compare very reasonably to similar venues.

The building itself is stunningly beautiful and the marriage of old and new structures is very well done. The cafe in the atrium is a lovely spot to sit and people-watch at any time. We have heard music from every genre in this hall and every time it is wonderful. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.title: Two great concerts within a week
text: On Sunday it was Tafelmusik playing Beethoven's Ninth; last night it was the Royal Conservatory Orchestra playing Tchaikovsky's First Piano Concerto and Rimsky-Korsakov's Scheherazade. Both performances were excellent; both were enhanced by the outstanding acoustics of Koerner Hall. It really is worth celebrating that in the last decade Toronto has gained both an opera house and a concert hall of high quality.

reviews.title: Excellent location for beethhoven
text: We had booked tickets for beethhoven 9th. Great seats and acoustics. Tafelmusik did a wonderful performance and choir was magnificent. A nice venue. Only criticism was no lemon or limes for G&T!
Worth a visit. Tickets reasonably priced.

reviews.title: Brilliant new concert hall.
text: Attended my first concert at Koerner Hall, the jewel in the newly renovated Royal Conservatory of Music on Bloor Street.  I recommend it highly.  Great acoustics. Comfy seating.  We were in the 'stage box', which put us pretty much right on the stage, within spitting distance of the performers.  I was impressed?

reviews.title: Excellent Acoustics in Koerner Hall
text: Attended the Oscar Peterson Tribute on Dec. 11 and it could not have been better acoustically or musically. A marvellous event and sold out, too! I have yet to go to a musical presentation at Koerner Hall and been disappointed. Check out their event schedule, select a performance and you will enjoy your experience.

reviews.title: Great Acoustics
text: The design of this hall is exceptional for acoustics.  The wood trim accentuates the sound throughout the hall.  The ceiling design is beautiful with curved wood pieces.  The lounge areas on each floor are comfortable and with great views of the park below.  Washrooms have lots of stalls too and that reduces lineups.  Seating is comfortable but not much leg room.  There are seats along the side and back of the stage but center seating is best.  As the sound is magnified, people who cough or rustle paper can be heard so the audience is warned in the program to be quiet and they are for the most part.  Great for instrumental or vocal music.  One of the best concert halls for sound in Toronto.

reviews.title: Architectually brilliant and wonderful accoustics
text: I just had the opportunity to be in Koerner Hall for the second time to enjoy the wonderful Tafelmusik Orchestra and Choir.
The Orchestra was lead by their new Musical Director in, what
I would call, a soft opening, as she actually doesn't officially take over until the new season that opens in September.

If you happen to be in Toronto when the orchestra is playing either at Koerner Hall or in their regular home at recently restored Trinity-St Paul Church (just down the road on Bloor Street) do go and hear some musical magic.
Then again if there is "anything" on at Koerner Hall don't miss
the opportunity to see and hear how wonderful it is!!

reviews.title: The Hall is great. I never had a bad seat yet.
text: I go to concerts in Koerner Hall several times a year. The variety of performances is incredible. Every music lover will find a performance they like. Koerner Hall also introduced me to new music by bringing in musicians ,who are not necessarily household names. The architecture alone is worth the price of admission. And if you budget is really low, they have several free concerts during the year. The program they publish is very informative and well put together. Koerner Hall is one of the best places to hear music in Toronto.

reviews.title: A Beautiful building and acoustically exceptional
text: We saw Alex Cuba there April 7, 2017 and it was a very enjoyable show. There isn't a bad seat in the house and it is very clean.  We were a little disappointed when we walked in and told the staff that it was pretty warm and they didn't seemed overly concerned or planned to do anything about it.  They could have been more sensitive on their response and say they'd look into it.  As I said the acoustics are very good but it would have helped if the folks (Mayfair?) had done a better live mix to maximize the high quality house PA.  Alex's guests that night included his dad on guitar/vocals, a pianist, 3 great horn players along with Steve Cuddy.  The horns were not brought to the volume deserved or appropriate which was quite disappointing.  In fact the guests pianist who was also VERY good, (quite strangely) sounded more like a synthesizer to steel-drum at times. Maybe not Koerner's fault.

reviews.title: Stunning Concert Hall
text: We have been to Koerner on many occasions and find the ambiance and acrostics to be of the highest standard and a challenger to any hall in any country. When you hear a concert at Koerner you will be awed by the colour and warmth of the sounds and visual beauty of the space.

reviews.title: Always Enjoyable
text: This is in my opinion the best place to listen to a concert in Toronto.  The seats are comfortable, the size is perfect and the hall has excellent acoustics. It is outstanding for vocal concerts.

reviews.title: stunning wooden interior design, great acoustic wall for classical concert
text: we watched Mozart classical concert of Toronto Symphony orchestra there. it feel that you are close to them. the sitting arrangement is fun, located 360 degree,  that you feel you are in the front row. the interior design was stunning with wooden panel.it is located next to the music school of U of Toronto in a modern building attached to the old building. we emjoy the architecture as well.

reviews.title: A Gem of a Concert Hall
text: Koerner Hall in the Royal Conservatory of Music on Bloor STreet is a real gem.  Designed by the notable architectural firm KPMB, it is really warm and inviting.   Perhaps most striking is the architectural feature called the veil - layered wooden ribbons floating above the auditorium, the pictures I've seen of it do not do it justice. Impeccable acoustics.

reviews.title: Exceptional elegance and extraordinary acoustics
text: My first visit to this fine performance space left me amazed.  I do not remember another "hall" with such fine, if not perfect acoustics. The space is elegant and intimate; perfect for concerts and solo performances.

reviews.title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful sound in a beautiful building that offers not only a wonderful array of concerts, but also pretty spaces which can be rented for private events. Great location - just steps from Yorkville.

reviews.title: Magnificent concert hall
text: In mid town toronto this venue is first class. Fabulous acoustics, great performances and an excellent event venue
Architecturally interesting. A Toronto treasure

reviews.title: Concert
text: By far the best place to catch a concert.  I have seen many concerts but this is Toronto’s premier venue

reviews.title: SMALL VENUE WITH PERFECT ACOUSTICS
text: During a day in Toronto with Canadian friends and some friends from home, we did some sightseeing and shopping before going to Koerner Hall to see a variety show.
Admission was free.
The relatively small hall had excellent acoustics.  Seating was quite comfortable.
This was an open-mic type show.  Each performer had 5 minutes to perform.  There were a lot of singers and guitarists.

Some were good; others were outstanding.  One of the best performers was a singer-guitarist named something like Danell Dougal, who sang a song he wrote named “Two Chairs.”  There was no program listing the performers, so spelling could be way off.  A good singer-guitarist named Billy Z.
We stayed for about an hour listening to the music.  We enjoyed it very much.
We rate Koerner Hall at 5.0 for its perfect acoustics. We highly recommend attending one of the hall’s low-cost or free concerts.

reviews.title: Hall itself enhances all performances
text: The design of this relatively small hall is exquisite & adds to the pleasure of any performance.  Looking around during Handel's Messiah last December & the Nicola Benedetti concert in January heightened the enjoyment of the wonderful sounds. Ushers are friendly & helpful.

reviews.title: Be sure to check
text: This concert hall is smaller than many however the acoustics are the BEST. No matter where you sit, it is easy to hear performances and see the stage. Many international performers come to this concert hall. Location is very easy to get to because it is right on the subway line. There are many restaurants in the area. As well, it is a safe location for walking and browsing.

reviews.title: Wonderful music venue
text: After living in Toronto for over 30 years, I finally went to a concert at Koerner Hall.  Not only is the venue a beautiful site, but the sound and vibe was excellent.  Keep an eye open for concerts there - it's a real treat!  Centrally located near on Bloor West near Yonge St., it is right next to Varsity Stadium.

reviews.title: Small but world class concert hall
text: I have had the pleasure of singing here several times with performers such as Jully Black and Steven Page and the sound is perfect! it is both acoustically and visually magnificent!

reviews.title: Wonderful Concert Venue
text: Lovely acoustics and superb programming (Julius Drake and Gerald Finley) were the reason my husband and I chose to come to Toronto. It was everything we had been looking forward to.

reviews.title: Great Venue For Jazz Music
text: Went to Koerner Hall for the first time and saw the Hot Sardines concert.  What a show.  The sound quality was good, the venue itself was really nice, the wood interior inside and the modern glass outside the hall made the place feel modern but classic.  There is a lot of stairs, but there is an elevator as well to get you to the different levels.  We were on the top balcony and still had a great view.  There was a snack bar on every level and washrooms as well.  Plus a cafe on the main level.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.  Can't wait to see another concert here.  $13.75 cab ride from union station if you take the train up, might be a bit cheaper in better road conditions, cab driver had to drive slow because of the freezing rain and what not on the roads.

reviews.title: Wonderful sound!
text: We have attended many concerts at Koerner Hall and have thoroughly enjoyed every one.  We live in Stratford and take the train into Toronto.  The sound is really great no matter where you are seated.  We attended Jazz Lives on Wednesday evening and the concert was terrific.   The house band was especially good and everyone seemed to have an enjoyable evening.

reviews.title: The TSO never sounded better!
text: We attended an all-Mozart concert in Koerner Hall this evening featuring the Toronto Symphony Orchestra. The TSO never sounded better, underlining once again the superiority of Koerner Hall's acoustics to those of Roy Thomson Hall.The highlight of the concert for us was the K.488 piano concerto (#23), with Charles Richard-Hamelin as the soloist. His performance was worthy of the orchestra and the hall: quite wonderful. Other works included the 41st Symphony 'Jupiter', also marvelous.

A word of caution: unless you like waiting while inhaling exhaust fumes, do not, repeat, do not park your car in the lot and especially not in the underground garage on the east side of Bedford Road. It took us fully 32 minutes to get out. Never again!
